item.title: Project 2: Mushroom Edibility Prediction
item.description: Introduction The goal of this project is to develop a machine learning model that can predict the edibility of mushrooms based on their descriptions. The dataset used for this project is derived from “The Audubon Society Field Guide to North American Mushrooms” and contains descriptions of hypothetical samples corresponding to 23 species of gilled mushrooms in the Agaricus and Lepiota family. Each species is identified as definitely edible, definitely poisonous, or of unknown edibility and not recommended.

item.title: About
item.description: A beautiful view of the Ocean and Earth in 2050 Data Science is a new passion and Environmental challenges is like Ikigai or purpose. I remembered when I was diving the ocean into the Sulawasi Indonesia, Bora Bora in Polynesia and Palau Islands, the beauty of the underwater world left me in awe. However, it also opened my eyes to the growing threats our oceans face. This realization, combined with my growing interest in environmental issues and the potential of AI, led me to explore how Data Science can be leveraged to address these critical environmental challenges.
